newsitem.title: GERMANY: DHL Germany H1 profits dip.
newsitem.headline: DHL Germany H1 profits dip.

text.p: DHL Worldwide Express GmbH, the Germany division of the global integrator, said profits fell to 5.2 million marks ($3.4 million) in the first half of 1996 compared to 6.4 million marks in the same period last year, a company statement said.
Meanwhile, the operator increased sales revenue 11 percent to 172 million marks in the first six months of 1996.
The profits dip was due to investment in expanding the network of outlets, expansion of electronic communications and a price reduction introduced in the spring, the statement added.
DHL said it expects turnover to grow 13 percent in 1996 due to the traditional strong autumn and winter demand.
The number of goods carried rose more than 15 percent in recent months, mainly due to growth in the transport of finished articles or spare parts, the integrator said.
The average weight of goods transported has risen to eight kilogrammes, it added.
DHL said its new price structure has reduced the cost of sending heavier goods and has cut prices to Asian growth markets such as Malaysia, the Philippines and Korea.
Employee numbers rose from 1,700 at the end of 1995 to 1,900, the statement said.
